normalised: What are some practical waste management solutions we can implement at a community level in India?

unnormalised: **What are some practical waste management solutions we can implement at a community level in India?**

normalised: Waste management is a huge issue in India, especially with cities like Mumbai and Delhi generating tons of garbage daily. We can’t just leave it all to the municipal corporations; we need to actively participate at the community level.

unnormalised: Waste management is a HUGE issue in India, especially with cities like Mumbai and Delhi generating tonnes of garbage daily. We can’t just leave it all to the municipal corporations; we need to actively participate at the community level.
normalised: One practical solution is robust segregation at the source. Think about it: separating wet waste (kitchen scraps, leftover rotis) from dry waste (plastic bottles, paper) makes recycling so much easier. My building in Bangalore has started composting, inspired by a workshop conducted by I I S C alumni. We’re turning veggie peels into valuable manure!

normalised: Another thing: reducing plastic consumption. Remember the movie “Water” and how things were packaged back then? We need to revisit those habits! Carrying your own bag to the sabzi mandi, refusing single-use plastics, and opting for reusable containers can make a significant difference.
